Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the interior is partly covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior, which is grooved and elaborated with incised wavy-line decoration, is covered with a self-slip and remains of one line of incised Coptic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394322) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394322)
